title: Proud Boys Supporter Eduard Florea Denied Bail in Weapons Case
sub_head: New York City man possessed more than 1,000 rounds of ammunition and made comments about senator-elect, complaint says
body:
A federal court judge in Brooklyn, N.Y., denied bail for Eduard Florea, a self-proclaimed Proud Boys supporter, and ordered him detained in U.S. custody while he awaits trial on charges that he possessed more than 1,000 rounds of ammunition.
U.S. Magistrate Judge Sanket Bulsara said Wednesday that Mr. Florea posed a significant danger to the community and reflected “a premeditated plan to exact violence.”
Mr. Florea posted several threatening statements before and during the attack of the U.S. Capitol last week, according to the complaint. These included comments about a U.S. senator-elect and travel plans to Washington, D.C., as part of a group armed with “guns cleaned and loaded.”
On Wednesday, Mr. Florea’s defense lawyer, Mia Eisner-Grynberg, urged the court to release him on a bond secured by him, his mother and his wife.
“This is not a case where Mr. Florea was found committing an act of violence,” Ms. Eisner-Grynberg said, criticizing the government’s reliance on a series of social-media posts.
